Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Question on SURT prefixes and URI canonicalization
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=6903103; y=wJqksj5K1lHcZui2Mo4Q2l8HtsdEEeRS2jT7dQLX9FmDDNWm
X-Yahoo-Profile: tree02139

Gordon Mohr writes:
> Some potential workarounds:
> 
>   - Starting in 1.4, the SurtPrefixScope will understand
>     lines in the seeds file that begin with a '+' as
>     directives to add additional SURT prefixes. For example:
> 
>       http://www2.dw-world.de/pashto
>       +http://(de,dw-world,www,
>       +http://(de,dw-world,www1,

This is going to work for my immediate needs. I also have a case where
these get redirected from wwww\d+ to plain www.

>   - Especially with a DecideRule-based scope, you could add
>     a MatchesRegExpDecideRule that rules-in varying subdomains
>     but requires the path prefix, eg:
> 
>      ^http://(www\d*\.)?dw-world.de/pashto.*

This would work even better, actually. 

> Hope this helps,

It does indeed, thanks Gordon.

    -tree
